alert.note: Alert for Blount (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 12:43PM CDT until May 06 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN KNOX...NORTHEASTERN BLOUNT AND WEST CENTRAL SEVIER COUNTIES... At 142 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Eagleton Village, or over Alcoa, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Maryville, Alcoa, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village, McMahan, Lake Forest, Seymour and Kimberlin Heights. This includes Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 395 and 398. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
